0.7.2: Self-mutating websites and Dat picker

Paul Frazee / Jun 5, 2017

Self-mutating websites üìù

Beaker now allows applications to modify their own files using the DatArchive API. This enables a model for simple, self-contained web apps such as wikis and todo lists. This decision is part of an ongoing security discussion. We‚Äôll blog about this soon.

Dat Garbage Collector üóë

This is something you probably thought Beaker already did. Surprise! We just got around to it.

As you browse Dat sites, you collect a cache of files which stay on your disk so that reloads are fast. The ‚ÄúGarbage Collector‚Äù clears out those cache files after 5 days of no access. The collector does not delete files of dats that the user has saved to their library.

Dat picker API üëÜ

Thanks to @taravancil we now have an API for selecting an archive from the user‚Äôs library, using a modal dialog. Think of this like the file-picker, for Dat archives. It includes the ability to create a new archive, if the user chooses.

Example usecase: a text editor would use this API to prompt the user for the Dat they want to edit.

var archive = await DatArchive.selectArchive({
  title: "Select an archive",
  buttonLabel: "Submit",
  filters: {isOwner: true}
})

How to install

If you already have Beaker installed on OSX, you can use the auto-updater to get the latest version. However, due to a bug in Beaker 0.7, you will need to use the settings page.

If you‚Äôre running Linux or if you‚Äôre new to Beaker, download the new version here.
